document_title: Pneumonia: Causes, signs, diagnosis and treatment
subsection_name: viem-phoi.json_8_9. How to care for patients with pneumonia
subsection_content:
9.1. Rest
Children with symptoms of pneumonia should not go to school. People with viral pneumonia also need to rest, limit communication, and go to work until they recover.
9.2. Stay hydrated
Drink plenty of fluids, especially water, to help thin the mucus in the lungs, making it easier to cough up.
9.3. Take medication as prescribed
Use correctly and fully according to prescription. Stopping medication too early when symptoms are relieved will cause the lungs to continue to contain bacteria, slowly multiplying and causing a relapse of pneumonia.
9.4. Ensure a clean living environment
Infectious pneumonia is very dangerous, so it is necessary to ensure hygiene and prevent infection by regularly changing bedsheets, mats, and blankets for patients. In the case of taking care of an elderly person with acute pneumonia who is in a coma and has to stay in bed for a long time, relatives should let the patient use antibacterial diapers to help ensure better personal hygiene. .
